basics.name: Chelsea L Edmonds
basics.label: Computer Scientist
basics.summary: Computer Scientist interested in all things formal verification and security, STEM Education Advocate, and Ambassador for Women in STEM

work.name: Department of Computer Science, University of Sheffield
work.summary: Research Associate on the EPSRC COVERT Grant exploring ''Safe and secure COncurrent programming for adVancEd aRchiTectures'' (PI's Prof. John Derrick & Dr. Andrei Popescu), a joint project with the University of Surrey and University of Kent

work.name: Boeing | PhantomWorks International
work.summary: Researched and developed cutting edge software and algorithms for autonomous systems in a fast paced and demanding environment from requirements to testing stages (using C#, C++, internal scripting languages). Completed a Systems Engineering course, the Boeing Australia Graduate program, and a part of the STEM Outreach program.

work.name: Boeing | PhantomWorks International
work.summary: Developed a prototype for an augmented reality system and was offered a graduate contract on completion.

work.name: RGB Assurance
work.summary: RGB Assurance is an engineering consultancy firm specialising in software development, testing, and verification for safety critical systems. Internship involved developing and demonstrating a working android application prototype to test new system feasibility.

education.summary: Supervised by Prof. Lawrence C.Paulson on thesis titled "Formal Combinatorial Structures and Proof Techniques in Isabelle/HOL". Developed new techniques for formally defining mathematical hierarchies, new libraries for combinatorial structures, and formal proof techniques. Viva passed January 2024, and currently awaiting final degree confirmation.

Achieved first class honours and a University Medal, Class of 2017 Future Leader, UQ EAIT Scholar. Completed a highly commended honours thesis ("A Model Instantiation of a Rely-Guarantee Algebra") supervised by Dr Larissa Meinicke and Prof Ian Hayes. Studied abroad for a semester at the University of Edinburgh
Practical examination in music performance and general knowledge to be recognised as an Associate in Music, Australia.

volunteer.summary: Responsible for leading a group of 23 student volunteers to support the 800-person graduate student community through running college wide initiatives, student communications, supporting sports/societies, peer welfare support, and organising social events. Served as a member of the main College Council, alongside various other college committees. Previously Sports and Societies officer 2021/22
highlights: implementation of new initiatives to connect fellows and students
EDI sucesses (e.g. Women in Academia Program)
established cost of living working group
student representative on university postgraduate mental health taskforce.

volunteer.summary: Responsible for the Computer Science Departments "Big Sister Little Sister" peer mentoring program and organised events such as roundtable and panel discussions to encourage mentoring across the department

Robogals is an international not-for-profit aiming to inspire, engage, and empower young women into STEM careers. As REO, I was a member of the global leadership team, and led the APAC team to run regional initiatives and support 15 chapters in 5 countries.
highlights: Rebuilt regions partnerships, chapter support, and cultural awareness strategies
led the organisation to achieve a Highly Commended Engineers Australia Diversity Award (not-for-profit category)

volunteer.summary: The local branch of Robogals for the University of Queensland. As President (and previously secretary), I rebuilt the chapter from 3 volunteers to a growing and stable chapter of over 40 volunteers and many external supporters. Additionally designed and led LEGO Mindstorms workshops for 6 to 18 year olds, logging over 165 individual teaching hours across 80 workshops.
Actively involved in many parts of the university community
highlights: Student Mentor for the UQ Young Scholars Program (2016 - 2017), an academic extension and enrichment opportunity for high achieving high school students
Women in Engineering Student Leader (2014 - 2015), an award winning initiative which sucessfully incresed gender diversity across the faculty
ICT Ambassador (2012 - 2014), representing the university at Open Days and study expos.

awards.title: Distinguished Paper Award
awards.summary: Distinguished papers are awarded to the top 10% of accepted conference papers

awards.title: Academic Award
awards.summary: Competitive award for PhD research excellence and the ability to communicate research to a non-expert audience.

awards.title: Silvia Breu Teaching Prize
awards.summary: Best Supervisor in Computer Science, as nominated by students and selected by college fellows.

awards.title: Cambridge Australia Poynton International PhD Scholarship
awards.summary: Competitive international PhD scholarship covering international fees and stipend

awards.title: Qualcomm PhD Studentship
awards.awarder: Department of Computer Science and Technology, Cambridge
awards.summary: Covered local portion of PhD fees and a conference travel allowance.

awards.title: University Medal
awards.summary: Awarded to top 5% of First Class Honours graduates in 2017.

awards.title: ICT Young Achiever Award
awards.summary: Awarded for leadership and notable contributions to the ICT industry in Queensland.

awards.title: Top100 Future Leader Australia - Software Engineering Prize Winner
awards.summary: National award program to recognise Australia's top universities and university students.

awards.title: Fourth Year Engineering Travelling Fund
awards.awarder: University of Queensland - Faculty of Engineering, Architecture and IT
awards.summary: Awarded for academic excellence while on exchange.

awards.title: Frank Joseph Murphy Bursary
awards.awarder: University of Queensland - Faculty of Engineering, Architecture and IT
awards.summary: Pre-exchange scholarship awarded for academic merit.

awards.title: Joan Wickham Memorial Prize
awards.awarder: University of Queensland - Faculty of Engineering, Architecture and IT
awards.summary: Awarded to the top women in engineering (based on GPA) after two years of study.
